columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess the initial public offering (IPO) of Mark Sexton and Todd Story.

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Underwriter fee  | 7% of IPO|
|Legal fees and expenses  | $2.1 million| 
|SEC registration fees  |$12,000 |
|Other filing fees  |$15,000 |
|Cost on listing on NASDAQ |$100,000|
|Transfer agent fees| $6,500|
|Engraving expenses |$520,000|
|Other expenses |$110,000|

The IPO cost percentage is computed as follows:


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{IPO cost percentage}&=\dfrac{\text{ Total cost}}{\text{IPO amount}}\\

\end{aligned}$$

First, let us determine the amount of the underwriter fee considering the IPO that amounts to $85,000,000.00. The underwriter fee is computed by multiplying the percentage of the underwriter fee by the IPO amount. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Underwriter fee }&={\text{ Underwriter fee rate $\times$ IPO amount}}\\[5pt]

&={\text{ 7\% $\times$ \$85,000,000.00}}\\[5pt]

&={\textbf{ \$5,950,000.00}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The underwriter fee amounts to $5,950,000.00.**

Next, let us determine the total cost, the company's costs incurred in processing the IPO. This is computed as follows: 
$$\begin {array}{lr}

\text{Underwriter fee}&\hspace{5pt}\text{\$5,950,000.00}\\
\text{Legal fees and expenses}&{\hspace{5pt}\text{2,100,000.00}}\\
\text{SEC registration fees }&\text{12,000.00}\\
\text{Other filing fees }&{\hspace{5pt}\text{15,000.00}}\\
\text{NASDAQ cost}&\text{100,000.00}\\
\text{Transfer agent fees}&\text{6,500.00}\\
\text{Engraving fees}&\text{530,000.00}\\
\text{Other expenses}&\underline{\hspace{13pt}\text{110,000.00}}\\
\textbf{Total cost}&{\underline{\underline{\text{\$8,823,500.00}}}}\\

\end{array}$$

**The total cost amounts to $8,823,500.00.**
**To conclude, the IPO cost percentage of the company is 10.38%.**

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
